data.title: Console output not working when Python's time.sleep() is used within a loop
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run the following Python script within VS Code:

```
import time
for x in range(10):
    print(time.time())
    time.sleep(5)
```


The time will not be printed to the output window.  But when the script is executed outside of VS Code, in a command line, the time will be properly printed at the beginning of each loop.

data.title: Codelens Overlapping after Combining Two Lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: f977399d58f7b64db35047fafe0c6e59e15f11d5
- OS Version: Mac 10.12 (16A323)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set `"typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled": true` 
2. Open a ts file that has code lenses on two lines next to each other:

```ts
class X {
private z: any
}
```

Place cursor before at the start of second line and delete the new line

**Bug**
The two code lenses temporarily are drawn on top of each other (look at the bit with the `18 references` text in the gif):

![jun-06-2017 14-55-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/26853822-6afbabf6-4ac8-11e7-9bb2-f644a3ce81a8.gif)

data.title: Fix TS 2.4 Errors in extHost.api.impl.ts
data.body:
**Errors**
In `extHost.api.impl.ts`:

```
[14:20:06] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts(121,63): Type 'ExtHostSCM' does not satisfy the constraint 'ExtHostSCMShape'.
  Types of property '$provideOriginalResource' are incompatible.
    Type '(sourceControlHandle: number, uri: URI) => TPromise<Uri>' is not assignable to type '(sourceControlHandle: number, uri: URI) => TPromise<URI>'.
      Type 'TPromise<Uri>' is not assignable to type 'TPromise<URI>'.
        Type 'Uri' is not assignable to type 'URI'.
          Property '_scheme' is missing in type 'Uri'.
[14:20:06] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts(300,9): Type '{ readonly activeTextEditor: ExtHostTextEditor; readonly visibleTextEditors: TextEditor[]; showTe...' is not assignable to type 'typeof window'.
  Types of property 'showInformationMessage' are incompatible.
    Type '(message: any, first: any, ...rest: any[]) => Thenable<string | MessageItem>' is not assignable to type '{ (message: string, ...items: string[]): Thenable<string>; (message: string, options: MessageOpti...'.
      Type 'Thenable<string | MessageItem>' is not assignable to type 'Thenable<string>'.
        Type 'string | MessageItem' is not assignable to type 'string'.
          Type 'MessageItem' is not assignable to type 'string'.
[14:20:06] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts(378,9): Type '{ rootPath: string; asRelativePath: (pathOrUri: string | Uri) => string; findFiles: (include: str...' is not assignable to type 'typeof workspace'.
  Types of property 'onDidChangeConfiguration' are incompatible.
    Type '(listener: () => any, thisArgs?: any, disposables?: Disposable[]) => IDisposable' is not assignable to type 'Event<void>'.
      Types of parameters 'listener' and 'listener' are incompatible.
```


**How to investigate**
* Install TS 2.4 in the vscode workspace by running `npm install typescript@next`
* Make sure vscode is using the workspace version of TS for error reporting by running the `Select TypeScript versions` command

data.title: Set window size and position?
data.body:
Is it possible to set the VS Code window size and position, either via `settings.json`, though an extension, or by some other mechanism?

In Atom, I can do this in my `init.coffee` file as such:

```
atom.commands.add 'atom-workspace',
    'custom:prepare-for-screencast': ->
        atom.setSize(1280, 720)
        atom.setPosition(37, 50)
```

Then I can call `Prepare for screencast` from the Command palette.

data.title: Atom feed is not valid: 'updated' is not RFC-3339 compliant
data.body:
The feed  https://code.visualstudio.com/feed.xml is not valid ([check it](http://www.feedvalidator.org/check.cgi?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcode.visualstudio.com%2Ffeed.xml)).

> updated must be an RFC-3339 date-time: Wed May 10 2017 00:00:00 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time)

Lines like these are not allowed:

    <updated>Wed May 10 2017 00:00:00 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time)</updated>

data.title: Cannot Prepend RegEx Match Group Replacement with a $

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enter some text in an editor
2. Enter the Find-Replace function (Ctrl-H)
3. Supply a RegEx that matches the entered text.  Ensure to create at least one capture group in the regex
   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11679900/26848653-2b8603f2-4acf-11e7-9346-479de2a4b1ec.png)

4. In the Replace text box, prepend the reference to a capture group ($1) with a $.
   Note that both a literal ```$``` and an escaped ```\$``` do not produce the expected behavior; while the behavior does differ between the methods.
5. Click the Replace button
   * Expected result: The matched text is replaced with the capture group, preceded by a ```$```
    
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11679900/26848737-7e2e15d6-4acf-11e7-8a97-645f88871498.png)

   * Actual result (Non-escaped ```$```): The matched text is replaced with the literal text ```$1```
    
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11679900/26848687-58294734-4acf-11e7-94c0-4a82629f8ecf.png)

  * Actual results (Escaped ```\$```): The matched text is replaced with ```\$$1```
    
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11679900/26848703-62478230-4acf-11e7-87d1-ccba4a130ceb.png)

data.title: html loses auto-indent when using custom grammars
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 - OS Version: Win 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install any custom JavaScript grammar (e.g. Microsoft's own [Latest TypeScript and JavaScript](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar), Microsoft's [JavaScript Atom Grammar](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.js-atom-grammar), or any of the Babel grammars. [Babel ES6/ES7](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=dzannotti.vscode-babel-coloring), [Sublime Babel](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=joshpeng.sublime-babel-vscode)) 2. Open a JavaScript file 3. Type ```div``` 4. Press Tab for Emmet to auto convert that to ```
``` 5. Press Enter --> it doesn't auto-indent the new line ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22549127/26846989-52303ff0-4ab0-11e7-85fa-07af171051c1.png) 6. Uninstall any custom JavaScript grammar, restart VS Code 7. Repeat steps 3-5 --> the desired auto-indentation occurs ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22549127/26847044-7fdeb274-4ab0-11e7-85e1-893733eadd94.png)

data.title: Fix more TS 2.4 Errors in VS Code codebase
Debug > Enable All Breakpoints missing?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 (Build 15063.296)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add few breakpoints
2. Click on _Debug > Disable All Breakpoints_

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11676976/26846567-afcad352-4b17-11e7-9c93-71fac433faeb.png)

All breakpoints are now disabled. But if I need to enable all breakpoints again, there is no way to do so. I have to individually toggle breakpoints. It would be painful to toggle each breakpoint manually in a troubleshooting scenario where one might have several breakpoints across multiple files. _Enable All Breakpoints_ would have done that in a click. 

I see _Deactivate Breakpoints_ and _Activate Breakpoints_ option in the breakpoints panel too can serve the purpose where I may use _Disable All Breakpoints_. 
* How do these two things differ, _Disable All Breakpoints_ versus _Deactivate Breakpoints_ & _Activate Breakpoints_? 
* Can Deactivate/Activate Breakpoints options be included in debug menu?

Apologies if I'm missing something, I couldn't find a way to enable all breakpoints. Please let me know if there is a way to enable all breakpoints.

Thanks!
Abhijit

data.title: Terminals created before panel is initialized have the wrong width
data.body:
This is happening because the pty is initialized with a width of 80 initially because we don't know about the dimensions of the screen. Maybe a resize should be run async after the panel is displayed?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/26846193-c75de956-4aad-11e7-84bf-51f147575f8b.png)

data.title: Go to Definition not working as expected for JSX tag
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 10.0.14393 N/A Build 14393

I've tried to isolate the issue to the following example, which is saved in `goto-test.js`.
```
import React from "react";
import Spinner from "components/spinner";
import { myConstants } from "constants/my-constants";

function GoToTest(props) {
  const foo = myConstants.foo;
  return (<Spinner />);
}
```    

Some test cases:

1. Putting the cursor on `myConstants` and pressing F12 correctly opens `constants/my-constants.js`
2. Putting the cursor on `myConstants`, right-clicking and choosing Go to Type Definition correctly opens `constants/my-constants.js`
3. Putting the cursor on `Spinner` and pressing F12 shows the "No Definition Found" tooltip. **This is unexpected.**
3. Putting the cursor on `Spinner`, right-clicking and choosing Go to Type Definition correctly opens `components/spinner.js`

There is something specific about this project causing this behavior, since F12 seems to work correctly for JSX tags in other projects. F12 also used to work normally for this project in the past. I don't know how to further debug this.

This project does not use TypeScript but I tried adding a `jsconfig.json` file to the project as per #22315, which did not change the behavior above.
